intro: Prenanthes racemiformis, commonly known as the raceme bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Araceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated inflorescence. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, often surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. Prenanthes racemiformis is an aquatic or semi-aquatic plant, often found floating on the surface of water bodies.
